intro: Hieracium imparile, commonly known as the common hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe, Asia, and North Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads composed of ray and disc florets. The plant typically grows to a height of 20–60 cm, with hairy, rough stems and alternate, heart-shaped to lanceolate leaves. Its flowers are yellow, with a single central ray floret and numerous yellow disc florets, blooming from June to September. Hieracium imparile is often found in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, and it is known for its ability to spread via rhizomes and seeds.
